headline: Cantor Cuts Robinhood (HOOD) Price Target, Keeps Overweight Rating
summary: Robinhood Markets, Inc. (NASDAQ:HOOD) is one of the 14 Most Promising Fintech Stocks to Invest In. On December 11, Cantor Fitzgerald lowered its price target on Robinhood Markets, Inc. (NASDAQ:HOOD) from $155 to $152 but kept an Overweight rating on the stock. This update comes after the company announced that it has entered into agreements […]

headline: Barclays Sees ‘Down-Year’ for Crypto in 2026 Without Big Catalysts
summary: Spot trading volumes are cooling, and investor enthusiasm is fading amid a lack of structural growth drivers, analysts wrote in a new report.

headline: Cathie Woods buys $13.4 million of tumbling tech stock
summary: Robinhood (HOOD) stock is sagging, but Cathie Wood treated the weakness like a two-day buy-the-dip event. On Dec. 11, ARK picked up 124,427 Robinhood shares worth nearly $16.9 million. Then on Dec. 12, it doubled down, adding another 108,557 shares valued at $13.4 million. Collectively, ...

headline: Construction is 'gating factor' for AI data centers. Space won't be.
summary: Space-based solar energy company Aetherflux is planning the launch of its "Galactic Brain" project, which will see AI data center compute being performed from space, for the first quarter of 2027. Aetherflux aims to solve and address concerns around data center cooling and energy sourcing through this endeavor. Aetherflux founder and CEO Baiju Bhatt joins Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to illustrate the current state of the AI infrastructure race — including NIMBY (Not In My Back Yard) concerns — and the company's plans for its first test of energy beaming from space to Earth. Bhatt is the co-founder and former co-CEO of Robinhood Markets (HOOD). Hear Baiju Bhatt explain Aetherflux's plans to harness solar energy for AI data centers from outer space. xAlso catch Yahoo Finance's interview with Reddit (RDDT) co-founder Alexis Ohanian, where the tech executive cites space-based data centers as the next innovation to come. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: Construction is 'gating factor' for AI data centers. Space won't be.
content.description:
Space-based solar energy company Aetherflux is planning the launch of its "Galactic Brain" project, which will see AI data center compute being performed from space, for the first quarter of 2027. Aetherflux aims to solve and address concerns around data center cooling and energy sourcing through this endeavor.

Aetherflux founder and CEO Baiju Bhatt joins Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to illustrate the current state of the AI infrastructure race — including NIMBY (Not In My Back Yard) concerns — and the company's plans for its first test of energy beaming from space to Earth.

Bhatt is the co-founder and former co-CEO of Robinhood Markets (HOOD).

Hear Baiju Bhatt explain Aetherflux's plans to harness solar energy for AI data centers from outer space.

xAlso catch Yahoo Finance's interview with Reddit (RDDT) co-founder Alexis Ohanian, where the tech executive cites space-based data centers as the next innovation to come.
